Quantum Valebant.definition: a count in a common-law action of assumpsit to recover the value of goods or materials furnished 2
Quantum Valebant.origin: [Latin, as much as they were worth]

1.definition: a count in a common-law action of assumpsit to recover the value of goods or materials furnished

2.definition: a theory or doctrine that permits recovery for materials provided on the basis of an implied contract
